data.Name: Kim Cortez
data.staff_bio: For the last eight years, Kim Cortez has worked as a vocational counselor helping people with disabilities find employment. At the Institute for Community Inclusion, Kim works in job coaching clients with developmental disabilities in employment settings from hospital offices to retail stores. As part of this process she has worked with several employers to create positions, including the Oak Square YMCA and Simmons College. Kim has presented at the APSE and TASH conferences, co-taught Boston public teachers how to work creatively with their transitioning students, and mentored others in her field. In addition to job coaching, she is quite familiar with assistive technology and how it can assist individuals in gaining employment, as well as adapting work areas to better suit an individual's learning style.
data.staff_ed: B.A., Psychology, University of Massachusetts Amherst
